item.title: Jessica add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "There isn't anyone out there who isn't Seymour's Fat Lady." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you odd." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jessica add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "The poetry of the earth is never dead." -- John Keats

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Love is the ultimate outlaw. It just won't adhere to any rules. The most any of us can do is to sign on as its accomplice. Instead of vowing to honor and obey, maybe we should swear to aid and abet. That would mean that security is out of the question. The words "make" and "stay" become inappropriate. My love for you has no strings attached. I love you for free." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Lucille Clifton
item.description: "may you kiss the wind then turn from it certain that it will love your back" -- Lucille Clifton

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Lorraine Hansberry
item.description: "The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely." -- Lorraine Hansberry

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "What a strange thing! to be alive beneath cherry blossoms." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I don’t think it would have all got me quite so down if just once in a while—just once in a while—there was at least some polite little perfunctory implication that knowledge should lead to wisdom, and that if it doesn't, it's just a disgusting waste of time! But there never is! You never even hear any hints dropped on a campus that wisdom is supposed to be the goal of knowledge. You hardly ever even hear the word 'wisdom' mentioned!" -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessica add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters
